meaningMnemonic: There is a <radical>lid</radical> covering all the <radical>mouth</radical>s that are too <radical>small</radical> to feed themselves, forming the <kanji>capital</kanji>. All of the small mouths come together and create a place where everyone can support each other.
readingMnemonic: To remember the reading きょう we use the Japanese city, Kyoto, which is spelled <reading>きょう</reading>と. It was once the capital of Japan! It was soooo full of mouths that came together that it was the capital for a long, long time.
